details:
AI model upgrade: Opus 4.6

The Auto AI model setting now uses Opus 4.6, delivering improved reasoning and code generation capabilities for a better AI-assisted spreadsheet experience.

Move multiple tables

You can now select and move multiple tables at once. This makes reorganizing your spreadsheet layout faster and easier, with proper handling of overlapping table positions.

Excel named ranges support

Excel imports now properly decode named ranges to A1 notation, improving compatibility when importing complex Excel files that use named ranges.

AI error handling improvements

Several improvements to AI reliability and error handling:

  • Buffered AI responses for smoother streaming and reduced parsing errors
  • Clear error message and new chat button when context length is exceeded
  • Dedicated error messaging for out-of-memory situations
  • Fixed AI suggestion crashes and safeguarded the formatting bar
  • Fixed AI response parsing errors

Bug fixes

Various bug fixes and stability improvements including:

  • Fixed floating table headers showing improperly on copy as PNG
  • Fixed share dialog triggering a page reload
  • Fixed scheduled task error handling
  • Improved performance for very large tables by optimizing content cache
  • Fixed sheet-not-found errors during navigation
  • Fixed N+1 query issue in Connections API calls
  • Fixed display buffer inconsistencies with column data

Agent mode

Introducing Agent modeâ€”a new way to interact with AI in Quadratic. Agent mode provides an enhanced, focused experience for working with your data:

  • Expanded chat interface with contextual suggestions
  • Smart file import suggestions when dragging files
  • Improved connection schema browsing
  • Toggle between Agent mode and standard mode from the top bar

Move files between teams

You can now move files between your personal space and team folders directly from within the spreadsheet. Access this feature from the File menu or the file name dropdown in the top bar.

Excel font size support

We've upgraded our Excel import/export capabilities to include font size support. Font sizes from Excel files are now preserved on import, and your font sizes will be exported when saving to Excel format.

Connections improvements

Several improvements to the connections experience:

  • Simplified workflow for creating new connections
  • Focus automatically shifts to chat when adding a connection
  • Added "Learn more" documentation links for connection setup
  • Improved visibility and UI for connection options

Bug fixes

Various bug fixes and improvements including:

  • Fixed hyperlink editing when the inline editor is open
  • Fixed a filter bug in cell type menu
  • Fixed alignment and styling issues

Feature walkthrough for new users

New users are now greeted with an interactive walkthrough that highlights key Quadratic features:

  • The infinite canvas with pinch-to-zoom navigation
  • External data connections for live dashboards
  • Scheduled tasks for automatic updates
  • AI-powered assistance for building formulas and workflows

The walkthrough can be skipped at any time and is disabled on mobile devices.

Free team file limits

Free teams can now edit up to 5 files. Files beyond this limit become read-only with an option to upgrade. A banner is displayed when the limit is exceeded, and individual files show an "Upgrade to edit" prompt.

AI thinking improvements

We've simplified the AI thinking UI to provide a cleaner, more streamlined experience when the AI is reasoning through your requests.

Bug fixes

Various bug fixes and improvements including:

  • Fixed an issue where inactive or archived connections were still being processed
  • Improved build performance for faster deployments

Streamlined onboarding

New users are now taken directly to create their first file after completing onboarding, making it faster to get started with Quadratic.

Synced connections improvements

We've made several improvements to synced connections:

  • Added semantic layers support for Google Analytics, Mixpanel, and Plaid connections
  • Improved sync status display in the code editor
  • Simplified sync state UI with better error messaging
  • Better handling of synced connection errors

JavaScript autocomplete enhancement

Improved JavaScript autocomplete so that (await q.cells()) now properly supports dot notation for method chaining.

Bug fixes

Various bug fixes and improvements including:

  • Fixed hyperlink popup positioning issues
  • Fixed template display bug and user filter in dashboard
  • Fixed bug with improperly deleting tables after spills
  • Fixed favicons in QA environment
  • Updated Plaid connection branding from Coinbase to Fidelity

AI connection bug fixes

Fixed a bug where starting a new file with an AI connection would fail to properly initialize. We also improved AI stability by filtering out empty tool calls that could cause errors.

File checkpoint improvements

Fixed an issue where file checkpoint update timestamps were not being properly recorded, ensuring more accurate file history tracking.

Internal improvements

Various internal improvements including:

  • Fixed scheduled tasks links
  • Improved CI reliability with retry logic
  • Enhanced preview deployment workflows

Connections list UI improvements

The connections list has been redesigned with improved styling, better responsiveness, and a more intuitive layout for managing your data connections.

AI chat improvements

AI thinking text now remains visible in the chat history, making it easier to follow the AI's reasoning process. We've also improved how formatting tool cards display when working with multiple cell selections.

Rich text fixes

We've resolved several issues with rich text formatting including:

  • Fixed width problems with multiple rich-text spans
  • Fixed italic clipping on first letters
  • Fixed strikethrough and underline rendering
  • Improved cell-level formatting synchronization with the inline editor

Bug fixes

Numerous bug fixes and stability improvements including:

  • Fixed hyperlinks remaining active over clipped areas
  • Prevented deletion of tables being referenced by other cells
  • Fixed single-cell code cell formatting issues
  • Fixed file history UI navigation
  • Improved backend robustness when generating file checkpoints

Rich text and hyperlinks

Cells now support rich text formatting with clickable hyperlinks. You can add, edit, and style links directly within cells for better navigation and interactivity in your spreadsheets.

Additional formulas

We've added many new formulas including financial functions (COUP*, IRR, NPV variants), date/time functions, and various utility formulas to expand spreadsheet capabilities.

Google Analytics connection

Connect directly to Google Analytics to pull your analytics data into Quadratic. Query multiple streams and tables, with full support for synced data and logging.

Performance improvements

Significant performance optimizations including improved bounds calculation, faster viewport-based hash rendering, and optimized fill operations for smoother editing of large spreadsheets.

Bug fixes

Numerous bug fixes and stability improvements including:

  • Fixed formula autocomplete behavior
  • Fixed sheet name trimming issues
  • Fixed table number editing
  • Improved text alignment and centering
  • Fixed glyph sizing and spacing
  • Improved file history with sequence numbers

@ mentions in AI chat

Type @ to mention specific items in the sheet. This helps the AI understand your intent and references.

Schema viewer

We've improved the schema viewing experience, adding it additionally to the AI chat any time a connection is opened. Browse your database schema while you seamlessly chat with your data.

Formula ranges

Instead of writing Formulas one cell at a time, AI can now insert ranges of Formulas to the sheet, enabling a much more efficient formula writing experience.

Bug fixes

We shipped numerous bug fixes and stability improvements in October.

  • Column grid lines missing
  • Disable negative grid headings
  • Limit sheet name length

View the complete list of features and bug fixes from October on GitHub here.

AI Chat

AI Chat lets you chat directly with your data and code in Quadratic spreadsheets. Creating business analytics just got super easy. With Quadratic AI, you can build charts and find insights from your data faster than ever.

AI code editor improvements

With the AI Assistant in the code editor, you can chat directly with your code. Write and edit Python, SQL, JavaScript, or formulas.

AI supports various models and scenarios

Quadratic AI supports a variety of models, including OpenAI and Anthropic models. You can use Anthropic models either directly from their cloud or via the models hosted on a Quadratic instance on AWS Bedrock.

You can also contact us for help with custom models in self-hosted Quadratic instances.

Numerous minor improvements and fixes

  • Dashboard design tweaks for readability
  • Improved new file dialogue
  • Design tweak for AI fix button
  • Hyperlink fix with colons
  • Error triangle disappearing immediately when fixed
  • Data validation centering fix
  • Dark mode fixes
  • Drag and move code cells duplication fix
  • Memory leak fix for better performance
  • Unfollowing from grid fix
  • Custom dates bug fix
  • Plotly chart speed up via CDN
  • Request proxy fix
  • Code cell artifact bug fix
  • Send new users straight to a file

New AI Models

Default: On Default, you'll notice a faster, more powerful experience. We are continually shipping improvements to our Default model to ensure a healthy balance of cost and performance for new users.

Max: On Max, we continuously upgrade to the model that performs best on our evaluations. The latest release from Anthropic, Claude Sonnet 4.5, delivers performance comparable to GPT-5 but with significantly faster speed. As a result, we've switched the model on Max from GPT-5 to Claude Sonnet 4.5 for our power users to get the best possible experience.

Semantic layer

Have specific quirks about your database you want AI to know about? Anything you enter in the semantic layer field of your connection details will be included in the AI's context.

SQL in left chat

You can now query your connections directly from the left-side AI chat. Previously, this could only be done from the code editor chat, with limited scope. Now, you can run fully agentic SQL queries from the left chat to query your database and immediately start analysis.

We will also be following up soon with lots of improvements to this experience, including better ways to view schema, narrow chat context, and more.

Bug fixes

We shipped numerous bug fixes and stability improvements in September. Some of these fixes include:

  • Remove letters from autocomplete
  • Copy as PNG closes context menu
  • Calendar properly showing for datetimes

View the complete list of features and bug fixes shipped from September on GitHub here.

Theming

Theming in Quadratic allows you to utilize the world's first dark mode spreadsheet and pick from a palette of pre-set accent colors.

Clickable links

You can now create clickable URLs in your spreadsheets that, when clicked, will open in a new browser tab.

Insert/delete columns and rows

You can now insert and delete single or multiple columns and rows.

Smart autocomplete

Smart autocomplete automatically suggests autocomplete options, using the content from adjacent cells to make recommendations. To fill in the recommended text, press the tab button.

Date & time formulas

We've added support for date and time formulas, allowing you to easily create and manipulate dates and times.

Numerous minor improvements and fixes

  • Reduce percentage decimal precision
  • Changing sheet saves input
  • Ctrl + ; inserts current time
  • Focus returns to grid when pressing esc on menus
  • Fix MATCH formula
  • Fix sheet drag locations in bottom bar
  • Fix auto-resize row bug and offsets
  • Change default AI model and tune temperature
  • Chart resizing fixes
  • Border menu improvements
  • Update code cells on undo/redo
  • Fix border clearing
  • New design for multiplayer avatars
  • Fix sheets stuck in pan mode
  • Keep go-to menu open when pressing Shift
  • Fix border formatting
  • Prevent paste on middle click on Linux
  • CSV delimiter improvements
  • Show logged-in user context when you don't have permissions on a file

changes: New tools and context for AI
details:
New tools and context for AI

We added many new tools for AI to access, including:

  • Insert/delete rows/columns
  • Table manipulation
  • Validations
  • Many more

AI should now have nearly complete access to common spreadsheet features. We also significantly improved AI context, with simpler and more comprehensive instructions.

Read about the full scope of our recent AI changes here in our Blog.

Broader Excel import formatting support

Until now, Excel imports only added data and formula to the sheet. Now we also support formatting on imports, including:

  • Font: bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, color
  • Background/fill color
  • Alignment: horizontal, vertical, wrap text, shrink to fit
  • Date, time, datetime
  • Number: commas, decimals, scientific, percentage, currency, exponent
  • Border: border style, border color
  • Layout: column width, row height

SQL schema filtering

One of our most active business users requested SQL schema filtering. We built and shipped the feature same-day. Have a feature you want built? Please let us know.

Bug fixes

We shipped a few minor bug fixes and stability improvements in August.

View the complete list of features and bug fixes from August on GitHub here.
